column5: Anyone know if it's legal to trap your own minnows in Ontario?

From the MNR rules for 2001: Bait-fishOnly resident anglers with a valid fishing licence may capture their own bait-fish for personal use, using a bait-fish trap, dip-net or seine, subject to the following restrictions: A recreational angler, who catches their own bait-fish for personal use, may have no more than 120 personally caughtbait-fish in their possession at any time. Any live holding box must be clearly marked with the name andaddress of the user.NOTE: Non-resident anglers cannot take bait-fish forpersonal use by any means.That should answer the question.Tom Kadlec((º>`·.¸¸.·´¯`·.. ><((((º>`·.¸¸.·´¯`·.¸><((((º>><((((º>`·.¸¸.·´¯`·.¸.·´¯`·...¸><((((º>¸¸.·´¯`·. ¸.`·.. ><((((º>`·.¸¸.·´¯`·.¸><((((º>¸¸.·´¯`·.¸.
